In many accents, the final /i/ in "baby" is reduced to /ɪ/, the lax counterpart of /iː/. So "baby" has an unstressed /i/ (or /ɪ/), and "even" has a stressed /iː/. Bingo! They are indeed similar-sounding.

Let's quickly rule out the other pairs just to be completely sure. "freedom, now" doesn't have a similar sound correspondence. "Yes, Reminded" is similar to my initial thoughts on "baby, even". "Rip, came" contains stressed phonemes and no unstressed ones.
